summary: After a bite from a genetically altered insect gives him superhuman abilities, teenage loser Rick Riker (Drake Bell) decides to use his powers for good. Donning an uncomfortably tight costume, Rick becomes a mysterious crime fighter known as "The Dragonfly." But standing in the way of truth, justice and the American Way is an evil villain known as "The Hourglass," who plans to become immortal by sucking the life force out of anyone who gets in his way.

reviews.content: Superhero Movie is one of, if not, the worst movie I have ever seen. It not only is riddled with sexual and dark, more the less messed up, jokes that are the least bit funny, but also insults fans of Spider-Man (2002) by crapping all over it's legacy.

15 years later this is still a silly good time Writer-director Craig Mazin teams with David Zucker to make a superhero movie....but one that's actually poking fun at them A collection of colorful actors like Drake Bell, Sara Paxton, Christopher McDonald, Brent Spiner, Kevin Hart, the late Leslie Nielsen, Regina Hall, Pamela Anderson, Tracy Morgan, and Jeffrey Tambor Thank god this is one of the better parodies NOT involving Jason Friedberg and Aaron Seltzer! Here the filmmakers are basically making fun of the first 'Spider-Man' having the main character named Rick Riker bitten by a dragonfly instead of a spider He develops super powers like strength, invulnerability, crawling to walls but he can't fly As expected he's in love with his next door neighbor Jill but doesn't have the courage to do anything Meanwhile the head CEO of Amalgamated Pharmaceuticals creates a way to stop death but he has to absorb other people's life energy to stay alive Hoping to make it permanent he plans to steal a rare mineral to absorb Empire City and Dragonfly is the only one who can stop him So many of these jokes and gags jab at 'X-Men', 'Fantastic Four' and 'Spider-Man' but also trying to maintain the heart of the story That's still notoriously difficult to do these days and humor isn't easy to balance Still this is one of the rare spoofs that manages to get some decent laughs It's not gonna work for everyone and one of the worst things in the movie involves the obligatory flatulence stuff, one scene in particular goes on for 5 minutes The pop culture references are expected too like Facebook and YouTube I definitely got the best bits from Nielsen and Hall Plus Drake Bell is a hoot to watch as a clumsy nerd becoming a hero next to Sara Paxton who's cute but still has a tremendous heart There's lots of instances where you can clearly see this was on a budget and some of the jokes haven't aged well but again this isn't high art we are looking for A decent enough comedy that'll kill an hour and a half making us appreciate real superhero movies
LOL, 01 hour: and 25 minutes of superhero-parody mania!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Hilarious spoof comedy. It really made my day. If you love superhero flicks or superheroes in general, you'll love this movie and you're going to laugh hard. Just don't take it seriously and you'll have fun.

This was honestly funny at times, but as spoofs go, it falls into the so bad its good category. Leslie Nielsen and Jeffrey Tambor were great in here, especially Nielsen. I always had a soft spot for Leslie Nielsen. The guy is hilarious. His mere presence makes me crack up, and I still don't know why. And yeah, I might be biased becuase this is one of the first spoofs I've ever seen, and back in the day I found it hilarious, but now it's really not for me. So if you unplug your brain, or get drunk, or get high, this might be the perfect movie to put on with some friends and laugh at the stupidity and brainlessness of this. It goes without saying that nothing makes sense in this movie because, again, it's just a brainless spoof combination of the Sam Raimi's Spider-Man, Batman, The X-Men and more.

A superhero spoof that doesn't reach its full ambition. It has some hilarious and spot-on jokes, but it also has dated pop culture references and other jokes that fall flat. However it's not as bad as the parodie "movies" by Friedberg and Seltzer.

A guilty pleasure of me. True, it falls into some of the same traps as the Friedberg-Seltzer films including making movie references based off of what was popular in the last two years but out of all the entries in the [Movie] Movie parody "series", this is the one that feels much more on par with the first three Scary Movie...movies. The jokes are hilarious, there are attempts to tell an actual story and the script is more competent than Epic Movie. Is it a dumb spoof movie? Yes. But it actually embraces it rather than just making a reference to that thing whose sole references are trailers and production notes rather than bothering to do any actual research.

really bad. barely funny. laughed a few times but most of the jokes failed. hard. and so many parts went on for way too long. after chuckling i would say "ok now they killed it" and they would do it 4 more times lol. so much terrible slapstick garbage. poorly made on so many levels. 

And the movie was only an hour and 8 minutes long excluding credits. I think that's shorter than the minimum, which is why i'm guessing they added a bunch of deleted scenes during the credits. that was not a mistake. i don't mean gag reels, i mean deleted scenes that were removed from various parts of the movie. i've never seen anything like it. It's several movies jammed into one that take the extra step after the scenes from the original movies stop.  With Marvel & DC putting out a movie for every comic ever made within the next couple years, hopefully the movie that makes fun of those is as funny as this one. Talk about pointlessness and silliness! Superhero movies are highly regarded for their fan-favourite characters and their non-stop action-packed sequences, visual effects and blockbuster entertainment. A parody, however, called Superhero Movie just totally mucks up what makes those movies achievable successes. 

Superhero Movie may be a parody that makes fun of superhero movies, like Scary Movie did it's genre, but Superhero Movie is far from looking at the better picture. It may have it's gags and laughable moments and you can't expect anything more exciting from a parody movie than it's laughs and mayhem, but how can you enjoy a spoof movie, entirely, if there's absolutely nothing at all to verify any importance to the story. It's a mucked up movie that goes nowhere. It's understandable when it's thought of, thoroughly, when acknowledging it's a spoof that doesn't need to meet any expectations besides the gags and jokes. 

It's overloaded with criticism for the following categories: bad directing, writing, acting, dialogue, cinematography and editing. These all fit the movie well as it's worst categories and the only real approval that can be gained from the movie, is when it finally ends.

What was I thinking? This is the craziest, most disgusting superhero movie parody ever made. It even poked fun of Batman, X-Men, Fantastic Four, and mostly Spider-Man. I say disgusting because it's crude, raunchy, and hilarious. OK, so I laughed myself silly. I admit it. I was in the mood for superhero movies. Sue me

Ricky Riker (Drake Bell) is a typical teenager, except that his luck is worse then most. Basically, he's a loser. He's been in love with beautiful Jill (Sara Paxton) for years, but is sure she doesn't know he exists. Even his techie best friend, Trey (Kevin Hart), is willing to throw him over for another clique. But Rick's life changes dramatically when a genetically enhanced dragonfly bites him during a school field trip. In a flash, he becomes the Dragonfly. He can scale buildings, and has immense strength - though he's still a klutz. Rick isn't sure he has what it takes to be a superhero, but it's up to him to save the city from the villainous Hourglass (Christopher McDonald).

also stars Leslie Nielsen, Brent Spiner, Jeffrey Tambor, Ryan Hansen, Robert Hays, Nicole Sullivan, Marion Ross and Pamela Anderson.

directed by Craig Mazin.

Best suited to (slightly immature) adults and teens, though I wouldn't advise for children, as they wouldn't understand many of the jokes. Also this film (in my experience) is far more enjoyed by men/boys than women/girls.
Any who remember classic 'Airplane' or 'The Naked Gun', this contains much of that sort of humour.

A spoof in 2008 of a dated 2002 Spider-man film. That's my biggest problem with this film, it is incredibly dated. It has a T-mobile Fav 5 joke. So much of it has been done before and done better in better films. This just wasn't funny and was a drag to get to. Kevin Hart was the only thing I liked, and he wasn't even in the film for much.
I liked it. It's funny and the critics are wrong.

This is hilarious -- in an American Pie kinda way. Less sex jokes, but I thought it was hilarious, especially Stephen Hawking saying "shit, shit, shit!" LOL!!! Mrs. Cunningham (aka Marion Ross) & Frank Drebin (aka Leslie Nielsen) are hilarious. Esta super, mega peladora pero para pasar un rato, esta buena.

Basically a spoof of the first Spider-man movie. If you've seen that, or if you are a big comic book person, then you'll appreciate many of the jokes. Includes a few shots at the X-Men & Fantastic Four but again, mainly the Spider-man franchise.

I went in expecting nothing. To my surprise, it was not a worthless throwaway spoof that cannot tie gags together in a coherent manner. It is not remarkable by any means, but it is kind of fun. The spoofing is very mainly targeted at the Spiderman series. They borrow from other sources as well, but these parts feel a little forced; so perhaps it is for the best that they kept it simple. There is not an effective train full of gags that a great spoof requires but at least there are not painful draughts of laugher. Drake Bell knows what he is doing, he knows it is ridiculous and he has fun with it. His high energy help prevent this movie from tanking. Also he gets great support from Christopher McDonald, Kevin Hart, and Leslie Nielsen, the king of spoofs. I only wish these secondary cast members were utilized even more, because they help immensely. Unfortunately the movie loses its discipline and prematurely wraps things up in a very haphazard manner. This is not polished at and all and it could have been better in many ways but it is worth watching and it is still a good time.
No continuity and very dated jokes.

I appreciate the opinions of the respected critics who have already reviewed this movie, but they massively misunderstood the movie (seemingly in every aspect). Yes the jokes are hugely overused and familiar even to the novices of the movie industry, but the whole idea of this movie (as was the scary movie series) is to make fun of the dull repetitive structure of superhero movies. This film despite using possibly too many fart jokes for one to bear, made me laugh from beginning to beyond the credits, and quite frankly was far funnier than a lot of movies that try to hard to be unique or clever in some regard. I am more than proud to say that this is a movie that I will return to in the near future, as my experience has been unmatched by any other movie that I have seen. Well... except maybe Scary Movie 3.
from the misleading front cover, to it's crude humour, this movie is unfunny and a waste of time and money.
I'd be outright lying if I said that I didn't laugh at least five or six times and some of those were fairly hearty laughs.

Movie parodies are a dying art.

I'm not talking about movie satires in general, no, that will always be around. I'm talking about actual movies that are spoofs. They just don't make movies like Spaceballs or Airplane anymore. Now we are stuck with "Movie movies", lazy, zeitgeisty, pop culture reference bloated "films" that are more focused on making the movie look funny than actually being funny. It's like watching a collection of manatee jokes from Family Guy for two hours; the only difference is that this is live action, barely. Granted Superhero Movie is not a cinematic atrocity like Epic Movie, but that doesn't mean it's any good.

This movie mainly parodies Spider-Man, with scenes with X-Men, Batman Begins, and so on. Unlike Epic Movie, this actually stays true to the title throughout. Only superhero movies are spoofed here. The number of movies being satirized is smaller than Epic Movie, but that just makes it more focused and more structured. For the majority of the gags, they actually feel like gags. Not good gags, but gags. In the aforementioned Epic Movie, the "jokes" feel more like references than jokes. 

Drake Bell of Drake & Josh fame stars in Epic Movie, and he is one of the two actors in this movie who actually aren't that bad. He plays a riff on the Tobey Maguire Peter Parker, and his comedic timing is often the only thing that works about the gags. He is throughout most of the movie the only straight faced actor on camera. Almost everybody else is winking at the camera and just being obnoxious. The one other decent performance is Leslie Nielsen, in one of his last ever movie roles. He plays the Uncle Ben/Alfred Pennyworth character. He tries the best he can to make the jokes enjoyable, and he occasionally succeeds,  but the script sucks so hard that not even Leslie "Don't Call Me Shirley" Nielsen can't be enjoyable.

So in the end, Superhero Movie isn't as awful as the Seltzerburg films, mainly due to decent performances from Bell and Nielsen, but even they don't make this worth watching. Somebody out there has to make another good spoof movie, the world needs it.
An endless string of well timed but old, tired gags. Even though some are really funny, many aren't, and either way you need more than that for a good movie.
Superhero Movie is a nicely-done, and neatly written parody film by the guys who brought you "Airplane'' and "Scary Movie 3''. One of the best parody films I've seen recently since "Stan Helsing''.
Though not the worst of the spoof genre, Superhero Movie still uses the same tired jokes.
I think it may be even worst than Scary Movie. Yup, it's that bad.
I like this. Funniest parody movie since Austin powers I believe. Really made me laugh. Not as funny to me any more though but it's still a funny film even if I liked it more as a kid.

The story is about Rick Riker played by Drake Bell whose dream girl is the girl next door Jill Johnson played by Sara Paxton. When he gets bitten by a genetically-engineered dragonfly, he turned into the superhero known as Dragonfly, possessing superpowers of a dragonfly except for flying. This is obviously a huge parody of Spider-Man. He witnesses a flashback in one scene where his parents are killed like in Batman Begins, giving the reason why he lives with his aunt and uncle played y Marion Ross and the late Leslie Nielsen. In order to control his powers, Xavier played by Tracy Morgan introduces him to his gifted school of superheroes like in X-Men where he meets Wolverine, Storm and Invisible Girl (parody of Invisible Woman from Fantastic Four) played by Pamela Anderson. When Dragonfly's nemesis, Lou Landers played by Christopher McDonald becomes the life-sucking Hourglass, it is up to Dragonfly to save Jill before Hourglass takes over the world. The film's main parody is Spider-Man. Other parodies that can be caught are Batman Begins, X-Men and Fantastic Four. I thought this was a good movie, it had a good story, made me laugh and did not center around too many movies to be called a parody. This is a good parody movie. Forget the Jason Friedberg and Aaron Steltzer shit and watch this because Superhero Movie gets a 9.5/10.

Another annoying parody that succubs to any kind of funny jokes and instead goes to safe ground with tired gags, pop culture references and a lack of sense of accomplishment. Stop these parodies, they're killing a once promising genre.
